snippet: An attack killed 26 people and underlined the confusion and complexity growing amid Syria’s protests.
abstract: Bomb tears through a crowded neighborhood in Damascus, Syria, killing 26 people and wounding dozens more; the bombing is the second in two weeks and underlines the growing confusion and complexity of the Syrian uprising.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad, Nada Bakri and an employee of The New York Times from Beirut, and an employee of The Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: An attack killed 26 people and underlined the confusion and complexity growing amid Syria’s protests.

headline.seo: Bombing in Damascus, Syria, Kills Dozens
headline.main: Bomb Kills Dozens in Damascus, Stoking Suspicions
headline.print_headline: Bomb Kills 26 in Damascus, and Each Side in Uprising Has a Theory

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
